appearance.title: Appearance

executor.helper: Choose the default agent configuration to use when creating a task attempt.

type.label: Editor Type
type.helper: Choose your preferred code editor interface.

customCommand.label: Custom Editor Command
customCommand.helper: Enter the command to launch your custom editor. This will be used to open files.

host.label: Remote SSH Host (Optional)
host.helper: Set this if Task Copilot is running on a remote server. When set, clicking "Open in Editor" will generate a URL to open your editor via SSH instead of spawning a local command.

user.label: Remote SSH User (Optional)
user.helper: SSH username for the remote connection. If not set, VS Code will use your SSH config or prompt you.

branchPrefix.label: Branch Prefix
branchPrefix.helper: Prefix for auto-generated branch names. Leave empty for no prefix.

autoDescription.label: Auto-generate PR description by default
autoDescription.helper: When enabled, the AI agent will automatically update the PR title and description after creation.

customPrompt.helper: Custom prompt for the AI agent when generating PR descriptions. Use {pr_number} and {pr_url} as placeholders.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.description: Control when and how you receive notifications.

sound.label: Sound Notifications
sound.helper: Play a sound when task attempts finish running.
sound.fileHelper: Choose the sound to play when tasks complete. Click the volume button to preview.

push.label: Push Notifications
push.helper: Show system notifications when task attempts finish running.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.description: Help improve Task Copilot by sharing anonymous usage data.

telemetry.label: Enable Telemetry
telemetry.helper: Enables anonymous usage events tracking to help improve the application. No prompts or project information are collected.

taskTemplates.title: Tags
taskTemplates.description: Create reusable text snippets that can be inserted into task descriptions using @tag_name.

manager.title: Task Tags
manager.noTags: No tags yet. Create reusable text snippets for common task descriptions. Use @tag_name in any task.
manager.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the tag "{{tagName}}"?

tagName.label: Tag Name
tagName.hint: Use this name with @ in task descriptions: @{{tagName}}
tagName.error: Tag name cannot contain spaces. Use underscores instead (e.g., my_tag)

content.label: Content
content.hint: Text that will be inserted when you use @{{tagName}} in task descriptions
content.placeholder: Enter the text that will be inserted when you use this tag

safety.title: Safety & Disclaimers
safety.description: Reset acknowledgments for safety warnings and onboarding.

agents.title: Coding Agent Configurations
agents.description: Customize the behavior of coding agents with different configurations.

availability.loginDetectedTooltip: Recent authentication credentials found for this agent
availability.installationFoundTooltip: Agent configuration found. You may need to log in to use it.
availability.notFoundTooltip: No previous usage detected. Agent may require installation and/or login.

errors.deleteFailed: Failed to delete configuration. Please try again.
errors.saveFailed: Failed to save agent configurations. Please try again.
errors.saveConfigFailed: Failed to save configuration. Please try again.

mcp.title: MCP Server Configuration
mcp.description: Configure Model Context Protocol servers to extend coding agent capabilities with custom tools and resources.

labels.agentHelper: Choose which agent to configure MCP servers for.
labels.serverHelper: Click a card to insert that MCP Server into the JSON above.

errors.applyFailed: Failed to apply MCP server configuration
errors.supportMessage: To use MCP servers, please select a different executor that supports MCP (Claude, Amp, Gemini, Codex, or Opencode) above.

selector.label: Select Project
selector.helper: Select a project to view and edit its configuration.

name.label: Project Name
name.helper: A display name for this project.

repoPath.label: Git Repository Path
repoPath.helper: The absolute path to your git repository on disk.

scripts.title: Scripts & Configuration
scripts.description: Configure setup, cleanup, and copy files for this project.

setup.label: Setup Script
setup.helper: This script runs from within the worktree after it's created and before the coding agent starts. Use it for setup tasks like installing dependencies or preparing the environment.
setup.parallelLabel: Run setup script in parallel with coding agent
setup.parallelHelper: When enabled, the setup script runs simultaneously with the coding agent instead of waiting for setup to complete first.

dev.label: Dev Server Script
dev.helper: Starts a development server from task attempts. Scripts execute from the workspace directory (one level above each repo's worktree) unless a working directory is specified below.

devWorkingDir.label: Dev Server Working Directory
devWorkingDir.helper: The directory to run the dev server script from, relative to the workspace root. Leave empty to run from the workspace root.

agentWorkingDir.label: Agent Working Directory
agentWorkingDir.helper: Default directory for new workspaces to run the coding agent from, relative to the workspace root. This value is captured when a workspace is created and won't affect existing workspaces. For single-repo projects, this defaults to the repo name. Leave empty to run from the workspace root.

cleanup.label: Cleanup Script
cleanup.helper: This script runs from within the worktree after coding agent execution, only if changes were made. Use it for quality assurance tasks like running linters, formatters, tests, or other validation steps. If no changes are made, this script is skipped.

copyFiles.label: Copy Files
copyFiles.helper: Comma-separated list of files to copy from the original project directory to the worktree. These files will be copied after the worktree is created but before the setup script runs. Useful for environment-specific files like .env, configuration files, and local settings. Make sure these are gitignored or they could get committed!

save.confirmSwitch: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to switch projects? Your changes will be lost.

jira.title: Jira Configuration
jira.description: Configure Jira integration for issue tracking.

enabled.label: Enable Jira Integration
enabled.helper: Connect to Jira to sync issues and track tasks.

email.label: Email
email.helper: The email address associated with your Jira account

apiToken.label: API Token
apiToken.helper: Generate an API token from your Jira account settings

ticketTemplate.label: Ticket Template
ticketTemplate.helper: Template for creating standard tickets in Jira. Use placeholders like {title} and {description}.

bugTemplate.label: Bug Template
bugTemplate.helper: Template for creating bug reports in Jira. Use placeholders like {title} and {description}.

slack.title: Slack Configuration
slack.description: Configure Slack integration for team communication and automated responses.

enabled.label: Enable Slack Integration
enabled.helper: Connect to Slack to receive notifications and enable automated responses.

botToken.label: Bot Token
botToken.helper: Your Slack Bot User OAuth Token. Get this from your Slack app settings.

enabled.label: Enable Auto-Reply
enabled.helper: Automatically respond to messages in Slack using AI.

tone.label: Reply Tone
tone.helper: Set the tone for automated replies (e.g., professional, friendly, casual).

perMessage.label: Enable per message
perMessage.helper: Allow enabling/disabling auto-reply for individual messages.

perChat.label: Enable per chat
perChat.helper: Allow enabling/disabling auto-reply for entire conversations.

keepContext.label: Keep conversation context
keepContext.helper: Remember previous messages in the conversation for contextual responses.

confluence.title: Confluence-Konfiguration
confluence.description: Confluence-Integration für Dokumentation und Wissensmanagement konfigurieren.

enabled.label: Confluence-Integration aktivieren
enabled.helper: Verbinden Sie sich mit Confluence, um Seiten zu erstellen und zu bearbeiten.

email.label: E-Mail
email.helper: Die E-Mail-Adresse, die Ihrem Confluence-Konto zugeordnet ist

apiToken.label: API-Token
apiToken.placeholder: Geben Sie Ihr Confluence API-Token ein
apiToken.helper: Generieren Sie ein API-Token in Ihren Atlassian-Kontoeinstellungen

spaceKey.label: Space-Schlüssel
spaceKey.helper: Der Schlüssel des Confluence-Space, in dem Seiten erstellt werden

parentPageId.label: Übergeordnete Seiten-ID (Optional)
parentPageId.helper: Standard-ID der übergeordneten Seite für neue Seiten. Leer lassen, um Seiten im Space-Root zu erstellen.
